reference_a:
@article{hensel2023,
  title = {The feasibility of using ecological momentary assessment to understand urinary and fecal incontinence experiences in adults with spina bifida: {{A}} 30-day study},
  shorttitle = {The feasibility of using ecological momentary assessment to understand urinary and fecal incontinence experiences in adults with spina bifida},
  author = {Hensel, Devon J. and Young, Audrey I. and Szymanski, Konrad M.},
  date = {2023-11-30},
  journaltitle = {PLOS ONE},
  shortjournal = {PLOS ONE},
  volume = {18},
  number = {11},
  pages = {e0292735},
  publisher = {Public Library of Science},
  issn = {1932-6203},
  doi = {10.1371/journal.pone.0292735}
}
sampling_scheme: 1x/day for a window of four hours
participants: adults with spina bifida and current symptoms of incontinence
additional_comments: more individuals in the dataset than in the published paper; partially implicit missingness; some variable coding unclear, some likert scales have "prefer not to answer" option

features.name: min_complete
features.coding: Coding unclear

features.name: distribution_channel
features.coding: email smsinvite

features.name: q_recaptcha_score
features.coding: Coding not clear

features.name: q_recaptcha_assessment_name
features.coding: Coding not clear

features.name: chores
features.coding: Did chores/housework

features.name: hobby
features.coding: Did a hobby

features.name: religious_service
features.coding: Went to religious service

features.name: sex
features.coding: Had sex

features.name: digital_communication
features.coding: Texted, called someone or used the internet (social media, email, etc.)

features.name: tv_movie
features.coding: Watched TV or movie

features.name: other_activity
features.coding: Other

features.name: other_activity_text
features.coding: Open-ended text for "Other"

features.name: nap_rest
features.coding: Took a nap or rested

features.name: ate_meal
features.coding: Ate a meal or snack

features.name: exercise
features.coding: Exercised

features.name: commute
features.coding: Took a bus, train, car or airplane

features.name: school_work
features.coding: Went to school or work

features.name: medical_appt
features.coding: Went to a medical appointment

features.name: alcohol
features.coding: Drank alcohol

features.name: tobacco
features.coding: Used tobacco ((cigarettes, vape, cigars, chew, etc.)

features.name: drugs
features.coding: Used other drugs (marijuana , cocaine, meth, etc)

features.name: family_friends
features.coding: Spent time with family or friends

features.name: activity_prefer_not_answer
features.coding: Prefer not to answer

features.name: amt_stool
features.coding:
How much stool did you typically leak today?
1 = A small amount (a little bit - a smear)  
2 = A medium amount  
3 = A large amount (a lot)  
99 = I prefer not to answer

features.name: amt_urine
features.coding:
How much urine did you usually leak today?
1 = A small amount (a little bit - a drip)  
2 = A medium amount  
3 = A large amount (a lot)  
99 = I prefer not to answer

features.name: angry
features.coding:
To what extent did you feel angry today?
1 = Not at all
2 = A little
3 = Moderately 
4 = Quite a bit 
5 = Extremely
99 = I prefer not to answer

features.coding:

features.name: sick
features.coding:
Were you sick or under the weather today?
0 = No
1 = Yes
99 = Prefer not to answer

features.name: stool_leak
features.coding:
How many times did you leak stool and get your underwear, pads, pull-ups or disposable underwear dirty today?
1 = None - I didn't leak any stool today
2 = One time
3 = Two times
4 = 3-5 times 
5 = 6 or more times
99 = I prefer not to answer
